name: Christy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
We loved our stay here! Our host, Stephanie, was awesome! I appreciated her quick response time, friendly nature, and willingness to share her knowledge of the local landscape.
The house itself was perfect for our family. The location was exactly what we were looking for. It was within easy walking or driving distance from most attractions on the Outer Banks. There is so much to do in this area, and the beaches are clean and gorgeous. The breeze that blew across the sound was incredibly relaxing and rejuvenating. When we wanted to be inside, the central air worked great to keep us cooler. The house was spotlessly clean, and we appreciated the full kitchen so much because my kids and I both have food allergies, and we preferred to make most of our meals ourselves.
The house felt incredibly private despite being closer to the road than I had imagined. It was not loud at all! I slept like a baby and the rest of my family did too! I highly recommend this property! Thanks Stephanie!!!

name: Jessica
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This sweet house was perfect for our two kiddos, ages 6 & 8. They loved fishing and crabbing off the private dock every chance they got. Early morning sunrise was incredible and very peaceful.
Kayaking, sunsets on the dock and the breeze off the water were wonderful. The tavern next door provided live music on the Friday we stayed! Very close to the wright memorial and bike paths that are fun too!
Stephanie was super responsive and helpful. We had everything we needed.
The drive to the beach side is about 5-7 minutes. This house is best for folks looking for a sound side experience, as a beach day does entail a notable drive across 158.
If you are in search of luxury and privacy, this is not your house. While we had everything we needed, and felt very comfortable, the house is on a major road where the traffic is frequent and the house is just as described “little”.
Cannot stress enough, where the front of the house is noisy and busy, the backyard feels like another world.

name: Kristina

Rating, 5 stars

August 2022

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Such a wonderful little house for our stay in North Carolina. It’s in such a perfect location. Not in the busy area but so close to everything there is that you would ever need while being there. No drive to any place ever took more than 15 minutes.
If you stay make sure you visit Steamers for dinner. Pricey but you won’t regret it one bit.
As for the house and land it is absolutely beautiful out back. They have everything in the back to relax and watch sun rise up. Did some fishing off the Pier and caught 2 puppy drum. Pretty sure with the right kind of bait you could hammer down on some fish. They are constantly jumping.
In the House it is extremely clean. That close to the water and we didn’t even see a fly in the house. Fly swatter available if you do find one. Had some snacks in a bowl in case we were hungry when we arrived. Creamers In the fridge and a stocked cabinet of salt sugar etc. The AC unit will freeze you out, if you let it, at 70 degree. Perfect perfect perfect.
Stephanie is very very responsive to any messages sent. Within minutes we had replies to anything we sent to her.

We enjoyed this home so much. My kids loved fishing, crabbing and kayaking. The view is better than any picture can show. We had everything we needed to make meals. The home was extremely clean. Stephanie was amazing. She answered questions immediately and gave us great suggestions while we were there. I highly recommend this home and can’t wait to visit again.

Also, we normally live in a very quiet location, so I was worried about the road noise since the road is busy, but we ran the fans that Stephanie provides and had absolutely no problem sleeping. We were all sad to leave such a great property!

review_text: This property is truly a gem! It is an older house but has been maintained well. The house is exactly as described and pictured. It is on a busy road which we knew prior to booking but honestly when inside the house or in the backyard we didn’t really notice the traffic noise. We enjoyed the included kayaks and this alone saved us money, kayak rentals can get expensive. The convenience of having them available anytime was also a nice perk! The house is very clean. The beds and couch were all very comfy. The house has has everything you need to feel right at home. We did not have to purchase any extra supplies for cooking or cleaning which is not usually the case when staying in a rental. Stephanie was very informative about restaurants and activities in the area and made it clear that she was available should we need her for anything.

The house is located on a busy road but we never heard anything and one of us was a light sleeper. It was a 20 minute walk to the beach and the Wright Bros monument was on the way. Great food in walking distance and there is even a bar next door. Stephanie was super responsive to our inquiries and offered helpful suggestions. This place is a gem and we would stay again given the opportunity.

The home was very clean and well stocked with those sneaky items you may have forgotten to pack. The location was close to everything the area had to offer! Whether it was kayaking, sight seeing, crabbing, fishing, or hitting the beach for some R&R... the days adventure always left you wanting more!

name: Stacy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Stephanie is a great host, she communicated well and suggested places to see and do. Her place is very nicely located only a couple minutes drive to the main area of food/activities. She has a dock and kayaks to use in the Sound water right in the back yard. The place is immaculately clean and the space is well thought out, there is plenty of room for two people and I'm sure 2 small children with their parents would be just fine there as well. One reviewer had mentioned creaky floors...yes they are creaky but for just the two of us we didn't really mind them but could see where some people may find them noisy. The house is located along a busy road so for people who are light sleepers, you should bring ear plugs or use the noise machine that Stephanie provides. The road traffic isn't bad between 10pm and 5am. She also has an outdoor shower for those days at the beach playing in the sand. The inside shower is on the small side but was fine for my wife and I for a couple days. Remember that this is an older house and the space has been used very well to have all the amenities she offers. If you have any questions before reserving, I'm sure Stephanie would be glad to answer them for you.

After a long day at the beach or exploring all that OBX has to offer, it was nice to enjoy the back yard and sound and go kayaking, or just take in the beautiful surroundings. The outdoor shower is perfect too after just coming back from the beach. Stephanie really went above and beyond with the little extra touches around the house. She had wonderful communication the entire time as well! I highly recommend booking Stephanie’s home when visiting the outer banks!

Stephanie was a very responsive host with lots of recommendations for activities in the area. Plenty of towels (both bath and beach) and some additional amenities for the beach was a great addition to help make sure we had everything we needed for our beach excursions.
While we didn’t do any crabbing, we did enjoy access to the kayaks during our stay.
The floors are pretty creaky, so if you’re traveling with others and are a light sleeper, you might want to pack some ear plugs. Once one person was up and moving, everyone was awake.

review_text: The first thing you need to know is that this house is on a very busy road that stays busy all night. I was able to hear traffic noises while I was going to sleep. There is also not an easy place to park next to this house on the busy road. I was told to parallel park in the yard. This makes getting in and out difficult. The busy road also feels intrusive when trying to kayak and enjoy the water view from the dock. The beach access is about a 5-10 minute drive away. One of the other reviews indicated that it is a walk to the beach. This is not the case. I can say that the bed is comfortable, and there is a well equipped kitchen and a nice outdoor shower. My son and I had a good time overall.

review_text: An amazing place to stay that is centrally located in the Outer Banks. Less an hour to Corolla and a little more than an hour to Hatteras. We were able to see all the Lighthouses, Jockey's Ridge, Wright Brothers memorial, Jennette's Pier, the NC Aquarium and Lost Colony play on Roanoke with ease. There are two beach access' about a 3 minute walk from the house, with one being at a fishing pier with parking. The house itself very intimate, comfortable, well stocked with a full kitchen and gas range/oven. Perfect for a couple who wants to balance cooking and eating out. A lot of natural light and an open ceiling plan kept the house nice and cool in the ~100 heat index we had through the week. The natural wood walls were always nice to look at. The host Amy is quick to respond and very nice. She shared restaurant ideas and kept in contact the whole week. It rained quite a few nights so we couldn't sit out on the lovely porch. Highly recommended for a couples Outer Banks getaway.

What a fun spot that is! You can also see a sliver of ocean and sunrise from the kitchen window and one of the bedroom windows. We loved the atmosphere of the space. It was a cold time of year when we stayed, and it was chilly inside despite the heating unit. So, I recommend packing the rt clothing. If you are traveling with another couple, note that the doors on the bathroom and bedroom are glass and transparent. So, privacy is limited in the small but wonderfully cozy, sweet space.

name: Lindsey
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Octopus Garden is the most delightful little cottage! Perfect for a romantic getaway for two - since it was just the two of us, we used the twin bedroom as a sitting room while we were writing. I’ve visited OBX for many years and this is my new favorite place to stay. For my wife, she’s only ever stayed in OBX a few times, first visit staying at The Octopus Garden. We stayed at a hotel for her second visit, and it just didn’t compare - so when we saw the cottage available during a 3-day weekend for us (we’re teachers), we just had to go! So it has become a special place for both of us. 😄
Amy is a spectacular host. I let her know we would be getting in late after work, so she left a light on for us, and she checked in to make sure we had everything we needed for our stay and was clear and kind in all of her communication.
Overall, the cottage is just as wonderful Amy is. The cottage is cozy, quaint, well taken care of, and decorated beautifully. The kitchen has great appliances and is stocked with some necessities already, same goes with the amazing bathroom. Seriously, even on this second visit, we still marvel at the bathroom despite having experienced it before. The smoothed stones create a delightful texture, and they are not slippery in the shower at all. I think my only wish for the cottage would be to add grab bars in the shower - with my cerebral palsy, my muscles are affected, which in turn affects my balance. So having a grab bar, rather than me leaning against the wall, would be helpful. Otherwise, the cottage is lovely and we can’t wait to return as soon as possible!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This quaint cottage is everything it says it is and more. Quaint and cozy, and a perfect spot for 2 or 3. It is located across the street from the beach, with easy and quick access to the ocean. No direct ocean view, but the front patio is perfect for enjoying the beach vibe. Well equipped, and when we couldnt find a cork screw, Amy was quick to deliver one in person! Communication is top notch, and the location is perfect to explore OBX to both the north and south. Comfy beds, great shower, and all the amenities you need when away from home - including a TV that allowed us to watch our favorite NFL team on Sunday Night Football. The one thing to be aware of is that privacy is a bit lacking in the cottage, as the bed and bathroom doors are glass and open up into the living area. The single bedroom does have a curtain to pull across the door, and the bathroom door has a bit of a cover over the door, but an open window into the living area (great for watching TV while brushing you teeth, however!) This was in no way an issue for us two friends traveling together, but if you do need 100% privacy in those locations, this is something you may want to know. I would not hesitate to recommend this cottage to a couple, close friends, or small family.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you are debating on booking this cottage - do yourself a favor and go for it! I can't say enough about what a special place this is. I traveled to the coast with my parents, and we had such a memorable time here.
We loved the decor - during the whole time we kept finding new decorations or a new dish or glass that we had not spotted before and we found so charming. The kitchen is just beautiful - and so well appointed, you really have everything you need to cook. We really enjoyed the front deck, we ate all our meals outside, enjoying the fresh sea air, and watching people drive or bike by. We found the beds to be very comfortable, and the linens and towels were a great quality.
The cottage is right across the street from the beach, and very close to public beach access. You can hear the waves at night from the beach house. Amy has supplied everything you could need to enjoy the beach, chairs, umbrella, boogies boards, and a cart to carry everything in. We took the chairs to the beach in the evening, and relaxed watching the water. There is an outdoor shower so you can wash sand off when you return.
Amy is hands down the nicest host I have encountered on Airbnb She responds to messages very quickly, was able to be very flexible with our group, and her warmth and genuine kindness was evident in all my communications with her.
I cannot recommend Amy and the Octopus Garden enough - we would love to come back!

review_text: Amy's beach cottage is nothing short of magnificent. It's cozy, perfect for a week on the Outer Banks. This is our second time staying here, with another upcoming next year. The towels and linens and bathroom are perfect, the bed is excellent, Amy had coffee and all the cooking utensils, the internet and cable TV are great, her communication is flawless, and she's pleasant and sweet natured -- you can see that she loves the Outer Banks and takes great pride in her cottage. My wife and I took a short walk across the street for a walk on the beach and the Avalon Pier, we had dinner at Awful Arthurs -- the prime rib on Fridays, with mac and cheese, lobster and crab bisque and oysters are all amazing. We loved Kill Devil Diner a few miles south on Virgina Dare Road and of course the ride to Hatteras is spectacular.

It’s a 1 minute walk to the fishing pier — which is a must for the views and arcade and bar (one of which is open to the sky) — Awful Arthur’s Oyster Bar is also a minute across from the pier. The location is perfect for day trips from Duck to Hatteras with plenty of shops and restaurants, and if you’re looking to take a walk with coffee for a sunrise over the sea, it’s right across the street. Perfect. Amy is amiable and sincere, her communication is fast and flawless. Octopus Garden is simply excellent on any measure.

review_text: I treated my fiancée to a 3-day trip to OBX (as she had never been before), so we celebrated her late birthday and our early anniversary. Travelers, if you are a couple (with or without a child or friend who can stay in the twin bed separate room), this cottage is for you! My fiancée and I adore this cottage and were so sad to leave. It felt like staying at a friend’s house, with thoughtful things like coffee and tea there already, and some basics in the fridge like a filtered water pitcher, coffee creamer and butter, then clean and fresh sheets and towels too - everything was clean and cozy. The location is also great, right in Kill Devil Hills on beach road. It’s just a quick 5 minute walk up the road, through the public access pass, and then you’re by the ocean. The house is well-furnished, and while I may not be the biggest fan of leather couches, overall the cottage is very comfortable and cozy. Amy is just a superstar, readily available when we had questions and compliments, and she made the check-in and check-out processes simple and easy. We already want to stay again, it’s just that lovely. Many thanks to Amy and the locals of OBX for being so friendly and amazing!!

The cottage had a cabin feel with very thoughtful details that made you feel at home. Hair dryer, shampoo, nail remover, hair spray, olive oil, were just a few of all the unexpected items available to use in the cottage. Amy was an awesome host, very responsive, understanding and even warned us about the bad weather ahead of time. Already decided to make it an annual retreat! Can’t wait to come back.

Great location right across the street from the public beach access. Beach cart and other supplies included. Small tv in sitting area, but we certainly weren’t there to watch tv all day. I will say privacy is very limited in the house - very open and airy- so make sure you are traveling with someone you don’t mind sharing intimate parts of the day with. I went with my husband so it was no issue at all. There is a small extra bedroom so if you have a young child, this house would also be a good fit for a family of three. Going to OBX in the midst of coronavirus turned out to be fine. Everything was generally open, masks were worn by majority especially in grocery stores. It appeared most rentals in the area were occupied and businesses were operating fairly normally while keeping in line with the state capacity requirements. Overall, you will not regret staying at this beautiful house. We will definitely be back next year.

This cottage looks even better in person! Everything in this home is well thought out and makes you feel as if it could be placed on a tropical island in the middle of nowhere.
Anything you could need is already there. With a fully furnished kitchen and a beautifully designed bathroom, we felt so comfortable being at the cottage for our week stay. Amy thought of everything - there are even outlets in corners of the room where you’d be sitting relaxing and might need to charge your devices (even though you should be enjoying the beach!). If this place is available, I definitely recommend staying here for a getaway!

name: Andy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I just got back from a short solo trip to OBX and stayed at the "Octopus's garden - cottage" and it was absolutely PERFECT. Obviously we all have our unique preferences and this place mapped to mine perfectly. It was such a great space - a cute A-frame style cottage that had clearly undergone a complete and very tasteful and thoughtful renovation. The space has very modern style amenities with an old school cottage feel e.g., the HVAC is a mini-split type system that works so well, I never once had to adjust the temperature from where it was set when I first walked in (and it's a high quality Trane so no fooling around in case you feel like being chilly).
You enter the space into the A-frame section and it immediately feels airy and open. The space is basically "open ceilings" and it's amazing how much bigger it looks and feels over the quoted size of 500 sq. ft. And while it stands under the shadow of one of those brand new Beach Rental Behemoths and is located on the beach road, the space is amazingly private and intimate. So much so that it's easy to forget how perfectly located it is to everything.
I didn't end up preparing any gourmet meals, which was a real shame since the kitchen is equipped with a full size Blomberg fridge and a beautiful Bertazzoni range and there's actually enough counter space to prep and cook and still set a place or two to eat. But the real bonus for me was an honest to goodness coffee maker. There's an amazing little coffee shop on Helga called "Ashley's Parlour" and the owner roasts on-site. Sitting on the front porch drinking a freshly brewed cup of locally roasted beans is the perfect start to the day.
The bathroom is equipped with a rather large and inviting shower that showcases the same beautifully tiled floor as the rest of the bathroom. There's also plenty of counter space for toiletries and a nice big sink for washing up and tooth brushing.
The bedroom is a nice size - just big enough, and there's a small dresser and a wardrobe for some storage as well as nightstands on both sides - and a handy power strip on one of the nightstands complete with built-in USB slots.
There's also another small sitting room/bedroom to boot, which I don't think I even stepped foot into.
And of course, there's a big porch, an outdoor shower, plenty of parking, and beach stuff for use as well.
No one ever wants to leave the beach and the last day is always sad, but after basically finding my ideal home away from home, it was especially tough.

review_text: The cottage is perfect for a couple, or a couple with a child. Right across from the beach and a beach access. The beach access is great: it does not have a parking lot, so the beach across from the cottage is not as crowded as it is further down the road at the access's that do have parking lots. The cottage itself is beautifully renovated: the kitchen and bathroom are completely modern, but fit in well with the old fashioned charm the skeleton of the cottage provides. The porch is great, you can see the water from there or from the kitchen while you cook. If you are looking to stay in a real beach cottage with modern touches, rather than a 3 story condo building, then you can't go wrong here. My husband and I stocked up on groceries once and never left the beach road again after that!

review_text: Sure, the more contemporary built beach houses are big and beautiful but they lack a nostalgia and charm that The Octopus' Garden has in spades. The perfect space for a couple's getaway, it may be small but it is open and airy and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is beautiful (the beach rock tiled floor!) though the sliding french style door with sheer curtain could be a bit of a surprise for some. We were a short walk from the public beach access as well as the Avalon pier- both we took advantage of daily. Delicious food is right down the street at Awful Arthur's or a short drive (in the off season) away. Amy is an amazing host and we enjoyed our time immensely. Should we find our way back to the OBX we will definitely book again.

Under C’s Adventure Apt was very clean. It was the perfect size for two people. I was surprised to see how many kitchen and bathroom necessities were included: forgot dish soap, body wash, tea? Don’t worry, it’s all there. It is surrounded by many restaurants offering a variety of cuisines and budgets.
Overall, we had a great stay and hope to come back again soon.

review_text: Very pleasant stay. The homeowners were great at communicating and easy to reach. Very clean. Close to beach. Good price. Would recommend to a couple or small family like ours (we have two little ones ages 3 and 11 months.) the only things to note (these are not a big deal to me but trying to be detailed)- because it is the first floor of a home- 1.) you don’t have your own control over the temp inside, so I had to text them about it being too hot for us and they quickly adjusted for us and checked to make sure we felt comfortable 2.) you will hear some footsteps upstairs (they were not loud) 3.) you have your own front porch and back porch but the front faces their driveway/road and back is in their yard so not super secluded if that’s what you’re looking for. Would definitely come back. My 3 year old already asked if we can go back to our “new home”.

name: Rebecca
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was exactly what we needed for the two of us! Very, very clean. Comfortable bed...we did not need to use the futon, but linens, and instructions, are provided if you do. Lauren has creatively turned this space into a very comfortable apartment. Wonderful storage areas for our personal stuff, plenty of towels, bathroom supplies, and toiletries. Very nice food prep area with fabulous deep sink. We honestly did not miss a stove. We used a crock pot for three meals and did not have to spend time cooking after being on the beach! We also had a butane hot plate we were able to use outside if we needed to. We only ate one meal out in 4 days/ nights. We planned meals ahead and brought a few kitchen items from home to add to what Lauren already supplies. There is table service for 4 provided. Coffee supplies and pods are provided, also a drip pot (bring your own coffee) and we used both. Full sized refrigerator with ice cube trays. This is a lovely, quiet neighborhood on the west side of the highway. So close to everything you might want to do. Parking for beach access was never a problem as there are three very close areas. This was just what we needed for our last minute beach get away!

review_text: We would highly recommend this apartment. It is everything as described and so much more. The apartment was very clean & spacious. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also very spacious and well supplied with lots of towels, shampoo, conditioner etc. The kitchen / dining area was also great & well equipped with coffee, creamer, paper towels, ice, chocolates & goodies. The apartment has its own parking space & is across the street from a dock where you can see beautiful sunsets over the Sound. The apartment is very well located to restaurants, Wright Brothers Memorial, Publix, Lowes and the beach. A great spot and we hope that we can return next year!!!

The place is located in a quiet little neighborhood, but a quick ride or walk to the beach, grocery store, restaurants, etc. Best of both worlds. Take a walk down to the nearby community pier to watch the sunset over the water. Amazing!
Would definitely recommend staying here and would come back ourselves when in the area again. Thanks for a great stay, Nick and Jessie!

review_text:
I loved this place and location. I have to mention there was an issue with the windows. We were not able to open them, and that was important to us. The owner offered to give us a total refund, which we declined. The windows we were told are planned to be fixed/replaced by early spring. Having said that, I gave this AIRBNB a five. The house felt like a cottage but with an updated open kitchen. A front and back deck so you could watch the sun rise and feel the sun set.
Washer/dryer worked great. Bathrooms were very nice, and one had a jacuzzi tub. To me, the location was amazing and we sat on the deck each night and enjoyed the sound of the waves. It is right on the beach and there is a private short walkway (10 feet?) to the beach.

name: Matthew
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
For a waking dream this is your place. The healing ocean vibrations permeate every inch of your living space. For a foodie, the kitchen is fully appointed for creating any masterful feast you can imagine. Local produce and seafood, tuna, crab, even live lobster from Maine just down the road. Hurricane Idalia was no match for the solid construction and made the experience more akin to sailing on a high class ship with the porch as the bow.
Jennifer was always instantly in contact and her place is a must stay on the magical Outer Banks!

name: William
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Adequate, not great. Fantastic location, not great accommodation. Home needs maintenance (mold growing on air vents, wobbly furniture, leaking patio hose bib, master bedroom window painted shut, loose stair tread, struggling air conditioning, terrible water pressure, etc).
No instructions on how to use TV remotes, and all had dead batteries which we had to replace ourselves.
Generally short on 'included' amenities: host left 'a starter amount' of toilet paper, liquid hand soap (1/3 full), laundry detergent, DW detergent pods, but nowhere near enough for a week. We had to replace all of that during our stay. No kitchen trash bags.
The biggest problem we had was that the internet failed on day 2 of our week (eventually found the neighbor's construction had caused an issue). Instead of dealing with this herself, our host gave us a number to call. It took 6 troubleshooting calls and 1 onsite visit, over 3 days that we had to manage ourselves as our own tech support. Not helpful.

name: Zarina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The bedrooms were very cozy with beds more comfortable than most hotels. The home was nicely equipped with games that made for a wonderful stay for families with kids of all ages (moms included)! Jennifer was so kind and quick to respond to any questions or concerns. There was an internet outage prior to our arrival, she made sure her internet provider came out to fix the issue. We also left some items in the home, I contacted her after we were well on our way home and she went out of her way to ensure we received them. The kitchen is so well equipped which was immensely helpful for meal times. We brought bikes and were able to bike to restaurants, stores and coffee shops. The home's neighborhood is centrally located with a 5-10 minute drive to grocery stores, movie theatres, and Target. Most of the home including the master bedroom had a fantastic ocean view. Overall my family loved our stay and we enthusiastically recommend this beach home!

review_text: Our family absolutely enjoyed our week at this home! We really appreciated all of the special touches that helped make this feel more like a family home verses a vacation rental. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed! The walk to the beach was only a few short steps. We enjoyed our coffee on the porch each morning watching the waves. Neighbors houses aren’t too close and we loved being able to walk to Awful Arthur’s take out window for lunch! We can’t wait to visit this house again!

We were traveling with toddlers, and found it pretty easy to toddler-proof one of the bunk bed rooms and the main living area. It was too cold to use the outdoor shower this trip, but it was a nice one!

We loved being able to walk right out on the beach and we liked the nearby restaurants, shopping and even the brand new Target! We loved staying here and have already recommended it to two friends who saw our vacation photos and asked for a link. We will happily stay here again and will keep recommending to all our family and friends.

The kitchen was the most stocked of any I have seen in an AirBnB. I didn't cook, but I definitely should have! The beds were comfortable and it would be a great place to come back with a larger group.
I would definitely recommend this beach house to anyone looking for a beach-front home on OBX!
Oh, and we enjoyed Angry Arthur's twice, which is just across the street!

review_text: Todd was an excellent host! He promptly responded to questions that I had before the trip. Upon arriving, there was an issue with the smart lock and Todd came within minutes to open the unit, quickly reset the lock, and provide us with helpful welcome information and tips. The location was perfect! Nearby is a walking path along the sound where morning walks and nightly sunset viewing is a must! I actually enjoyed the peacefulness of being on the sound side versus the beach. Although, the beach was still only a quick two to three minute drive away where sunrise viewing was equally enjoyable. The unit was clean, quiet, and comfortable! We especially enjoyed sitting on the front porch and ending our days on the very comfy couch. If you enjoy a good sound system and large tv experience you will love it here. I highly recommend Todd’s place and look forward to staying again in the future.

review_text: The most comfortable vacation rental that we have ever stayed at. Extremely clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable layout. Bed and linens were super comfortable. Restaurants, tons of shopping and beach are all walkable or just a few minutes driveway. We did a lot of day trips to fish out of Oregon Inlet, visit friends in Wanchese and Mateo (super charming historic fishing towns about 30 minutes away), and checked out Hatteras (90 minutes away along the most beautiful road...must do!). Evenings we enjoyed spreading out the large sectional couch watching fishing shows on the gigantic TV with the most incredible sound system. Todd is an excellent host, very responsive and friendly. He texted us prior to 4 that the home was ready for check-in which I thought was nice. We can' wait to come back. Really felt like home away from home.

Weather was amazing so we spent most of our time outside, but I'd have no complaints staying in on a rainy day with the giant TV, surround sound speakers, cozy blankets, and board games. We did not meet Todd but check-in and check-out instructions were straightforward and he was very quick to respond to any questions we had. Thanks for a wonderful time!

The kitchen was well stocked, they had a toaster, a coffee maker and a Keurig (and coffee filters! Yay!), and shampoo and conditioner in the showers. Good brands, too. The tvs are easy to navigate and the place is so tastefully decorated you’ll want to redesign your personal home after staying here.
The only thing I would say is that if you don’t like firm beds, this may not be the Airbnb for you. If you do, don’t hesitate to book this trip.

review_text:
This listing is S T U N N I N G! Everything, just everything, stunning.
The entire house is brand new, it is so clean it was basically sparkling. It smells good and clean and it is decorated like out of a magazine!
The beds are memory foam and very comfortable! Im tell y’all, the linens- sheets, pillows, comforters and throw blankets were on ridiculous! Honestly, the towels are unreal! and we really loved that there were real plants throughout the unit. There were games and cards available.
The porch is sooooo nice and my favorite part! There are six chairs and it was just so nice to sit out on and listen to some music!
Todd was readily available via messaging and check in and check out instructions were provided and literally the most detailed and helpful!
NOT TO MENTION, if you walk down to the end of the street towards the water (sound) there is this little tiny beach, where the water comes up to the road, where we fished a little and there is a ROPE SWING!!!! We watched the sunset and sat on the swing! It was so fun and a perfect photo op!
It was absolutely PERFECT! We will be staying here again, without a doubt!

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a very pleasant getaway! Very clean, comfortable, and cozy. Our host was extremely gracious and helpful, we faced no issues at all. I loved the welcome book with local recommendations. Very relaxing!
Tasteful artwork fills each space.
3 or 4 steps up to the back entrance, with an easy-to-use lockbox. The master bath has double sinks and storage. The master bedroom has a comfortable king size bed and ~65" smart tv. Great storage is provided.
The second bedroom has a queen size bed, ~55" smart tv, great closet space to hang clothes and coats, and guest bath.
The kitchen has granite countertops, island surface cooktop, and all equipment needed for cooking meals or just having a glass of wine. The spacious living room provides a large smart tv, fireplace, and windows that span near 180 degrees, overlooking Kitty Hawk Bay and Albemarle Sound - stunning views highlighted by stunning sunsets. The back deck has room for several people and afternoon sunshine.

review_text:
I must say first and foremost Carrie was absolutely great in responding to my messages both prior to us arriving and during our stay. Although check-in was not until 4pm Friday afternoon Carrie informed me the house was ready at 8:59 am that morning and we were cleared to check in whenever we arrived in town. This was so great because we drove from Northern Virginia and arrived in Outer Banks at 1pm so after lunch we were able to go straight to the house instead of killing time before check-in.
The House - The house was so cozy and although it was our first time staying there, we felt like we were at home the first night. The house was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Unfortunately, the weather turned very cold and windy with both rain and light snow flurries while we stayed so we didn't get to enjoy the deck overlooking the water as we planned but it definitely made for some great sleeping weather. I highly recommend this house and we will be back!!!

review_text: This is such an amazing OBX cottage. We had the most wonderful time - the perfect location for a last few family days at the beach before school starts up again. The house is very clean and very well equipped with everything you need in the kitchen, games for the whole family, and even soaps, shampoo etc in the bathroom - such a great detail. The most amazing part is the deck right by the water with stunning sunset, sunrise, and night sky views. It comes with a picnic table for outdoor family dinners and is large enough to comfortably roll out a yoga mat (or two). Our kids loved the community pool access, which is close to the house. It's an easy drive to the beaches, shops, and restaurants. Carrie and Colin are great and very responsive. Highly recommend this little slice of heaven on the OBX.

I am assuming Carrie and Colin knew we were traveling with our kids and they left snacks and kids” body wash/ shampoo. I am used to having to take everything to the Outer Banks but the house was equipped with everything we needed to make our stay enjoyable and comfortable. The folks in Colington Harbor were all so friendly. The small private beach is perfect for small kids and the pool was nice. If you want to go to the ocean, the day use area is easy to get to. Thanks for making our first Airbnb so wonderful!

review_text:
Perfect for our 1 night stay in Kill Devil Hills. Situated in a nice, quiet neighborhood, the apartment itself is fine with the bedroom cozy and clean. The bed is listed as a queen so not questioning that but it seemed slightly smaller than a standard queen to us. An adjacent room gives space for use of the microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Provided 'to go' coffee cups, wine glasses and some plastic knives and forks were welcome.
The outside area gives this space its edge over other properties - a very pleasant place to sit with chairs provided and a canopy above to provide shade - you basically have the whole backyard to yourself.
Gia, the host, is great - lots of communication, useful resources of things to do and discounts for local restaurants. The flexibility on check in for our stay was also very welcome.
Good place to stay if in the area.

review_text: This was a really great airbnb and overall a great experience in obx. It is a pretty nice sized suite for the price and has all the basics we needed for our stay. Great location, very clean, everything worked well, and we were very comfortable in the space. A perfect spot for two looking for a weekend getaway. The host provided us great info on the local eateries and activities that made our stay extra special. She went the extra mile to communicate with us and accommodate us. She even gave us a gift certificate for a discount at a local bar/restaurant we liked a lot and ended up hanging out at for awhile - a perfect little date night. We also rented a golf cart from the host which was SO MUCH FUN!! It came with a cooler which was perfect for getting to and from the beach and made parking a breeze. Was it necessary? Probably not. But driving around in a cute little buggy near the beach was such a fun and retro experience we will remember. Overall, a great time with the help of a great host.

We have two young kids, and the location on the beach made this great for enjoying the beach while hauling our stuff a minimal distance and getting back easily for naps. The indoor pool was perfect for stormy/rainy days, while the outdoor pool and splash pad kept our family entertained when they didn’t want to get sandy. Eddie’s place was spotless with a great kitchen for cooking our meals—we didn’t leave once after we arrived. Eddie responded to all of our needs and messages in less than 5 minutes each time as well . We are already looking forward to booking this exact condo again the next time we come to the outer banks!

review_text:
What a great feeling to walk into an Airbnb rental to find that the description, photos and prior guest reviews were all accurate in the location and conditions. The rooms, bedrooms and bathrooms were spacious with quality finishes and furnishings. Host was very responsive to inquiries and request.
Our end of March trip time was ideal in reduced crowds and fortunately wonderful weather. Not an issue for us, however, should you have children suggest checking on the pool status being seasonally open or closed. The quick and easy access to the beach as well as the fourth-floor western views to sunsets and the Wright Brothers National Memorial were great. Would definitely consider staying at this location again!
Thank you, Eddie for a fantastic first visit experience to your place and Kill Devil Hills!

name: Rebecca

Rating, 5 stars
,

July 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Lynn’s place was great! We loved our stay here. I was looking for a place to stay with my 7 year old on an impromptu trip to the OBX, and this fit the bill perfectly.
This Airbnb is small, just a room, a closet, and a bathroom, but it had everything we needed and was the perfect size for the two of us. The mini fridge, microwave, and little table outside allowed us to save our money and eat in for most meals. I’m not much of a coffee drinker, but the little coffee cart was well stocked with pods for the coffee maker, sweeteners, and even little salt and pepper packets, which came in handy when I forgot to bring any myself. The room was very clean, quiet, and the bed was comfortable. The pool was the perfect size for us, very clean, and so nice to have as an option on the days my kiddo wasn’t feeling the beach. We ran into the hosts a couple of times in passing and they were kind and welcoming and very respectful of our privacy. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again in the future!

review_text: Room is exactly as pictured and described. Everything is in new condition and very well organized. Very clean, close to parking and overall a great room. It is small; a double bed with 2 nightstands, TV and cabinet in the bedroom with a coffee maker in the closet. Bathroom has a full tub/shower and is likewise in excellent condition with plenty of space. Main room is a little tight but fine for 2 people and right near the beach. If you don't need a lot of walking around room and just need a very clean and comfortable place to stay for two, this is the place. Very nice detailed instructions and tips in a binder. Well-priced for a room this nice and this close to the beach. Lynn was very responsive and communicated well. Hope to stay there again sometime.

review_text: I would highly recommend staying here! Lynn and Tom were fantastic hosts. Lynn kept me updated on Hurricane news and was flexible while we decided whether to make the trip. Tom made us feel welcomed and took good care of us. The space is amazing! Private bedroom and bathroom. Small fridge with freezer. Microwave. TV. Keurig coffee pot with coffee and choices of sweetener and cream. Extra towels and toiletries. And much more. The pool area was incredible. We enjoyed an evening swim after playing volleyball with a full moon lighting the sky. We enjoyed our morning coffee and listened to music poolside before taking another swim before getting ready to leave. I wish we had more time to spend there! Totally relaxed and chill space. Thanks again Lynn and Tom!

review_text: The hosts were incredibly nice! Wonderful actually! Super on top of everything and ever responsive. The Check in was effortless and the place was very clean! It was close to the beach as well. Really the only issue was the lack of privacy and the extreme paper thin walls...and the sketchy fact that you could not lock the place and the people in the main house had access to it at any time. Sadly it was not able to be a romantic or private place due to those factors. If you don't mind that then I would recommend this place to anyone, but if you are really looking for a quiet and secluded place, you might be better elseware.

review_text: Perfect vacation spot! Not only is the location perfect, but the hosts went above and beyond to make our stay personal and relaxing. I had told Lynn that I had booked our trip for an anniversary, and we arrived to a bottle of wine and a "happy anniversary" message on the bedside table! The amenities included like private deck, grill, beach chairs/umbrella, bathroom products, etc, really made our stay so much more comfortable. When we checked out we were even given a sea shell plant decoration to take home! I've stayed at many Airbnb's, but this one is the best I've been to. The hospitality is unmatched!

review_text: Lynn was a wonderful host and the little shell-a-holic spot she's created for guests is clean, comfortable, and the perfect little place of respit just a 3 minute walk from the beach. Lynn was quick to respond to any inquiries and even helped me with a technical snafu on my end. Loved the little chill out spot in the corner of the porch. We could see the sunrise from there. Thanks again, Lynn, for a great stay in the Outer Banks!

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was the perfect little "hole in the wall". Such a cute spot for a couple or even a solo beach goer (like me!). You're less than a 5 minute walk to the beach access directly across the street. Walk down to Goombays for some great seafood after a long day at the beach or drive 5 minutes to Awlful Arthur's for my favorite steamer baskets. The room had everything I needed, a mini-fridge (with a small freezer), a microwave and even a Keurig. The bathroom was stocked with extra towels and small toiletries for her guests. Lynn really goes above and beyond to make sure everything turns out great on your trip and that you're enjoying your stay! She's a quick communicator which is perfect. I'll gladly be back soon!
